Evaluation_Questions: How well did this course, to the extent promised in the syllabus, enable “conversation across lines of difference,” integrate practical and theoretical concerns, or consider and integrate issues of class, gender/sexuality, race/ethnicity, dis/ability, and or global/cultural diversity
Comments_Questions: What were the strengths and weaknesses of your Teaching Fellow as an instructor and how might his/her teaching be improved
What was the name of your practicum instructor
What were her/his strengths or weaknesses
Comments_List:
Strengths
+ Gets everyone to participate in section
+ Has clear expectations for group discussion
+ Available for outside help 
+ Really good at helping us dive into the texts and various assignments

Improvement
 Give us more historical context that might have been missing from lecture before diving into the readings

Cody was a fabulous Teaching Fellow. She encouraged structured discussion by giving us different discussion activities each week in section. She encouraged us to think for ourselves while still engaging critically with our texts. She prepared us extremely well for all assignments.
Cody did a great job overall. Her feedback was clear and helpful, and she brought a great energy to the classroom.
My Teaching Fellow was Nazanin Sullivan.

Nazanin did a wonderful job tying together some very dense readings, and I looked forward to attending her discussion section each week.  I am thankful to know her; her teaching skills are creative with a healthy mix of individual thought, small group work, and large group discussion.  She also took the time to look up additional media relevant to our readings.

Good effort at encouraging dialogue during sections.  Very dedicated to helping class with assignments, etc.  This complaint is for sections in general.  I wish there was more lecture and less conversation.

Nazanin was an AMAZING TF!! I loved her - she led great section discussions and really guided our understanding of the material. Her support with preparation for papers and tests was also top notch - I felt very comfortable bringing my questions and issues to her. I think she's the best TF I've had throughout my time at Yale - and that's saying a lot!
Nazanin was a strong section leader. I would highly recommend her !! She made the class for me.

I cannot praise Cody enough - she was easily one of the best TFs I have had. Not only was she consistently prepared for and engaged in section, she really went above and beyond the call of duty. Each week she brought new ways of going about discussion (my favorite was musical chairs - I liked getting to talk with people all around the room one-on-one). She was also impressively ready to handle lulls in conversation by pointing us to relevant passages and asking new questions. I also remember how she went out of her way to put together a book review guide for us after our section was uncertain about how best to write one.
Nazanin was extremely helpful. She provided helpful feedback on papers and tests. She conducted sections in a productive manner that make it easy to engage and learn.
